p: Two studies conducted in Brazil exclusively examined infection rates by Zika virus in wild mosquito populations ( Table 2). Ferreira-de-Brito et al. [ 31] reported three Zika-infected pools of Ae. aegypti, but no Zika-infected Cx. quinquefasciatus or Ae. albopictus pool [ 31], out of 468 tested pools among the three species. Ayll√≥n et al. [ 32] tested 406 Ae. aegypti and 11 Ae. albopictus field-collected individuals, and found three Zika-infected Ae. aegypti individuals.
